intro: Luzula colensoi var. macrostemon, commonly known as the large-stemmed woodrush, is a perennial plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. It has slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Its botanical features make it an important component of New Zealand's native flora.
